reviews.productTitle: MOES Smart Double Light Switches, 2.4GHz Wi-Fi 2 Gang Single Pole Switch, Netural Wire Required, Inteligente Switch Combo Work with Alexa Google Assistant, Remote Controlgle Assistant, Remote Control
reviews.text: Change your Wi-Fi and all hell breaks lose. The app won't help to connect this device to a new Wi-Fi network. It won't help you to add the switch again with the hope that it will let you connect to the new Wi-Fi. The app's add-device function won't find the switch, so it tells you to put the switch in a pairing mode, but there is no where to tell you how to put the switch in the pairing mode. You can try to add the device manually, but the app would make you search through dozens of different devices, and my smart switch device is not on the list. There is no search function to find your device without manually browsing through their dozens of devices. The more I write this review, the more mad I'm at the company for their laziness, the more I reduced the number of stars. It's down to one star now.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on May 9, 2025
reviews.title: Inferior app!

reviews.productTitle: MOES Smart Double Light Switches, 2.4GHz Wi-Fi 2 Gang Single Pole Switch, Netural Wire Required, Inteligente Switch Combo Work with Alexa Google Assistant, Remote Controlgle Assistant, Remote Control
reviews.text: I bought this switch with a specific purpose in mind. I wanted to convert a double gang set of switches to one slot so I could install an outlet in the other. One of the switches to be replaced controls the light in a walk in closet. I like motion switches for closets, but this one is on a wall outside the closet. So, by making it a smart switch I could put a stand alone motion detector inside the closet and set routines to turn it on and off. This switch fit the bill. Physical installation was straightforward and easy. Find the supply hot wire and both loads, hook to the marked terminals at the top of the switch. Add a jumper from the neutral wires since the old switches were load only. I followed the directions and downloaded the MOES app and created an account. Tried to add the switch and it warned me about 2.4 GHz wifi only. My ISP provided gateway REALLY wants you to use the same SSID for 5 and 2.4 GHz networks and it is a PITA to change it. I had a 2.4 only extender available and switch my phone to it and was able to set up the switch. Then I went to set up the link to my SmartThings app so I could control it with a Zigbee motion detector. The instructions told me to link SmartLife, which I had already done for some smart plugs I have had for a couple of years. That's when I figured out the MOES app is just a pared down version of SmartLife. Deleted the switch from the MOES app and opened SmartLife. The switch was already detected and added with a single click. SmartLife then made it available to SmartThings and I was able to set the routines using my Third Reality motion detector. So, my advice is skip the MOES app and use SmartLife instead. Integration to SmartThings and Alexa are easier.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on December 7, 2024
reviews.title: Product is OK. App is trash. Use SmartLife instead.

reviews.text: As I have been digging deeper into the smart home rabbit hole, this smart switch has been perfect to replace my regular switches on Smart light bulbs. It is annoying when you install a smart lightbulb on a regular switch and then accidentally turn the lights switch off. Then that defeats the entire purpose of the smart bulb and you have to manually turn the switch on for it to work again. Installation is really easy and the instructions provided were great. I definitely recommend these smart switches to bring your smart home to the next level.

reviews.title: Great for advanced smart home users!

reviews.productTitle: MOES Smart Double Light Switches, 2.4GHz Wi-Fi 2 Gang Single Pole Switch, Netural Wire Required, Inteligente Switch Combo Work with Alexa Google Assistant, Remote Controlgle Assistant, Remote Control
reviews.text: Others have commented on the limited 10 Amp capacity of the switch and its acceptance of only small gauge wire. It is not UL approved. It is CE approved which means it is appropriate for European use not US use. With the migration to LED lighting a switch from 15 amp to 10 amp lighting circuits may be coming soon. But don't use this in a non lighting situation. You need the advise of a licensed electrician. It is not safe for homeowners without training to use these devices.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on August 19, 2024
reviews.title: This is not certified for US

reviews.text: These wee affordable and easy to setup and use manually and in the app. I have one issue and one problem with them so far. Firstly they only work on 2.4GHz which isn’t a problem for me since my home network is dual band. But I can see issues with range from access points and overall connectivity issues because of the 2.4ghz. Secondly is I’ve had one freeze up where it turned on the lights it is attached to and refused to respond manually or through the app. I had to cut the power to it and then force it into pairing mode. Will definitely keep an eye out for similar issues with the others
